title: 1990 Vermeer 505 Super I round baler for sale | no-reserve Internet auction May 25 2016

subtasks: Enter the combine harvester
Adjust the combine settings for the crop type
Start the combine engine and warm up
Operate the steering while moving through the field
Monitor the combine's harvest rate and adjust speed if necessary
Check for cropchaff and straw distribution
Manage the cleaning system and separation of grain
Check for blockages and clean as needed
Watch for combine malfunctions and make on-site repairs if possible
Park the combine at the end of the row or field
Drive the grain cart to the combine's location
Connect the grain cart to the combine's discharge auger
Monitor the grain cart's load and dump when full
Drive the grain cart to the holding bins or warehouse
Discharge the grain from the cart into the bins or truck
Monitor the combine'sPerformance( yield monitor) and ensure proper harvesting efficiency
Adjust the cutting height or header for optimal crop pickup
Check for lodged or downed plants and make necessary adjustments
Remove any obstructions in the combine or grain flow path
Monitor grain quality and adjust to prevent damage or loss
Inspect the grain trailer for load capacity and proper coupling
Drive the grain truck to the combine's location
Connect the combine's auger to the grain truck's fill port
Load the grain truck with harvested crops
Use the grain metering system to adjust flow rate
Secure the trailer coupling and ensure safety chains are attached
Drive the grain truck to the designated location for grain unloading
Disconnect the auger and weigh the load for accounting purposes
Drive a grain auger into the silo or bin
Connect the grain auger to the source (grain cart, truck, or combine)
Verify the auger's power supply and set the flow rate
Guide the grain into the silo, checking for uneven loading
Monitor grain levels and stop loadingwhen desired capacity is reached
Close the auger and cover the silo opening
Check the silo's stability after loading
Inspect the combine's hydraulics, electrical systems, and filters
Clean the combine and replace any components as needed
Lubricate moving parts and service the engine oil
Test the lighting and signaling systems for safety
Check and inflate the tires if necessary
Organize spare parts and tools for future maintenance

tasks.task: Conduct post-harvest soil testing for nutrient management
subtasks: Sampling the field to collect soil samples
Use a soil probe or auger to collect samples from different depths
Mix samples from the same field and send to lab for analysis
Interpret the results and plan fertilizer application rates for the next season
Document the nutrient levels and recommendations
Clean and maintain equipment for storage
Recondition machinery for the upcoming planting season
Order and stock necessary parts and supplies
Plan the planting schedule based on weather forecasts and field conditions
Prepare the farm financial plans for the next cycle
Organize personnel for the upcoming planting season
